title: shakshuka
ingredients: 2 Anaheim peppers; seeds removed and diced
28oz high quality tomatoes; e.g., san marzano
1 handful of chopped parsley; can also used chopped cilantro or thinly sliced green onion as garnish
1/4 cup crumbled feta; best from a block vs. pre-crumbled
olive oil and pepper to finish
(optional) fresh or pickled radish for garnish
instructions: Heat a 12–14" pan on medium heat. Add onions, peppers, a few tablespoons of olive oil and a small pinch of salt and
Add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add the cumin and smoked paprika and cook for 30 more. Dump in the tomatoes
This is a good time to taste the sauce and season it until it's right.
Create egg divots with the back of a spoon and distribute the eggs into the divots. Spoon the sauce over some of the
Once the eggs are just about cooked, remove from heat and sprinkle with feta and parsley, a light drizzle of a good
notes: Goes well with baguette or naan. Can add lots of different veggies to the base: carrots, radishes, green beans, eggplant, etc. Also goes well with a drizzle of tahini sauce. Goya makes the best canned chickpeas. I like sprinkling on some Trader Joe's "Everything But the Bagel" spice mixture on top. Can also add a green with the chickpeas like lacinato kale or de-stemmed swiss chard.
